Class AppLayout

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
com.project.ui.AppLayout
public class AppLayout extends javafx.application.Application
The AppLayout class represents the main layout of a JavaFX application integrated with Spring Boot. This class extends Application and is responsible for initializing the Spring context, configuring the user interface, and properly shutting down the application.

In the init() method, the Spring Boot context is started using the MainLauncher class, and the SpringContextHolder bean is retrieved.

The start(Stage stage) method creates the main scene of the application, setting the views for the left sidebar, main content, and right sidebar, and then configures the window icon and title.

The stop() method is responsible for closing the Spring context when the application is shut down.

    • init

      public void init() throws Exception
      Initializes the Spring Boot application context. Starts Spring Boot using the MainLauncher class and retrieves the SpringContextHolder bean.
      Overrides:
      init in class javafx.application.Application
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during context initialization

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Creates and configures the main scene of the JavaFX application. Retrieves beans from the Spring Boot context responsible for the main content and sidebars, sets them in a BorderPane layout, and then configures the window icon and title.
      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application
      Parameters:
      stage - the main window of the JavaFX application

    • stop

      public void stop() throws Exception
      Closes the Spring Boot application context when the application is shut down.
      Overrides:
      stop in class javafx.application.Application
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs while closing the context
